text: KFIV (1360 kHz) is a commercial AM radio station in Modesto, California. It airs a talk radio format and is owned by iHeartMedia, Inc. Its studios and offices are on Lancey Drive in Modesto. KFIV is powered at 4,000 watts by day. But to avoid interfering with other stations on 1360 AM, it reduces power at night to 950 watts. It uses a directional antenna at all times. The transmitter is off Sylvan Avenue on the east side of Modesto.Radio- Locator.com/KFIV ==Programming== Most weekday programming is nationally syndicated conservative talk shows from co-owned Premiere Networks. They include The Glenn Beck Program, The Rush Limbaugh Show, The Sean Hannity Show, Chad Benson and Coast to Coast AM with George Noory. From Westwood One, the station also carries The Mark Levin Show. Weekends feature shows on health, money, car repair, real estate and guns, some of which are paid brokered programming. Syndicated weekend shows include Leo Laporte, Handel on The Law, The Jesus Christ Show and Bill Cunningham, as well as replays of some weekday shows. Most hours begin with world and national news from Fox News Radio. ==History== In 1950, the station signed on the air as KMOD.Broadcasting Yearbook 1951 page 90 It was owned by Radio Modesto, Inc. and was powered at 1,000 watts. KMOD was a network affiliate of ABC Radio. In the 1960s and 70s, KMOD was a popular Contemporary Top 40 station. In 1985, the call sign switched to KFIV. In 2000, KFIV was acquired by Clear Channel Communications, the forerunner to today's iHeartMedia, Inc.Broadcasting & Cable Yearbook 2010 page D-95 ==References== ==External links== * FIV Category:Modesto, California Category:Mass media in Stanislaus County, California Category:San Jose State Spartans football broadcasters Category:Radio stations established in 1950 Category:IHeartMedia radio stations
title: KFIV
